attributes.action: build a Thames Estuary Tidal Barrage to generate clean (non-nuclear / atomic) electricity and to act as an outer barrier to protect London from exceptionally high tides or possible sea level rise due to the natural phenomenom of global warming.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Thames Estuary Tidal Barrage could be sited to the east of Southend-on-Sea, Essex and Sheerness, Isle of Sheppey, Kent with possibly another barrage between Sheppey and the mainland.
There would be locks for shipping.
A new motorway or dual-carriageway could be built on the barrage giving a new north / south road link miles to the east of the Dartford Crossing.
Wind turbines could be built along the length of the barrage.
Please see another person's petition for a Severn Estuary Tidal Barrage, 'severnbarrage', and my other petition for two tidal barrages across The Solent, 'Wightbarrage'.
